lessons.japanese: 君の青春が終わったと思うのももっともだ。
lessons.english: You may have good reason to think that your youth is over.

lessons.japanese: 一生のうちで青春なんて一度しかない。
lessons.english: Youth comes but once in life.

lessons.japanese: まさにあの曲が、私に青春時代を思い出させた。
lessons.english: That very tune reminded me of my adolescence.

lessons.japanese: だれしも、楽しい青春を平穏無事な時期として想い起こす。
lessons.english: Everyone remembers the happy days of his youth as his halcyon days.

lessons.japanese: その老人はほとんどの時間を青春時代を回顧して過ごした。
lessons.english: The old man spent most of his time looking back on his youth.

lessons.japanese: 僕らは青春の真っ只中だ。
lessons.english: We are in the heyday of youth.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は今が青春の盛りだ。
lessons.english: She is in the bloom of youth.

lessons.japanese: 誰も、楽しい青春を平穏無事な時期として思い起こす。
lessons.english: Everyone remembers the happy days of youth as his halcyon days.

lessons.japanese: 青春時代を怠けて過ごすな。さもないと後で後悔するぞ。
lessons.english: Do not idle away your youth or you will regret it later.

lessons.japanese: 青春期の若者はしばしば両親と衝突する。
lessons.english: Adolescents often quarrel with their parents.

lessons.japanese: 青春期がどのくらい長く続くかは生物学的要因によって決る。
lessons.english: How long adolescence continues is determined by biological factors.

lessons.japanese: 青春を遊んで過ごしたことを後悔している。
lessons.english: I regret having idled away my youth.

lessons.japanese: 若い時は二度とない、青春は一度しかない。
自分の失われた青春を考えても無駄である。
lessons.english: It's no use thinking about one's lost youth.

lessons.japanese: 私達の会議中に彼は自分の青春について言及した。
lessons.english: In the course of our conversation, he referred to his youth.
